intro: Conocephalus canescens, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marshy environments in North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes grass-like plants commonly referred to as sedges. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of flowers that are typically green to reddish in color. Conocephalus canescens is often found in shallow water or moist soil, contributing to the ecological stability of its habitat. Its structure and growth habits make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
